climbs.name: No Way Down Direct AKA "Tyrolean Tower"

content.description: This is the direct finish to "No Way Down". A double direct version is in Sven's guidebook as "Tyrolean Tower" and starts at the "Southeast rounded corner" of the tower and is rated at 5.10d. I looked at the corner and didn't see any pro whatsoever so I led this version instead.
content.protection: TR or Trad. Good pro to the over-hang then "R" to the top. There is gear near the top in a see-through crack in the back of a block. I.E. the block could pull. Also, on the left corner there is a jug that can be palmed on but flexs when pulled out ward.
content.location: Front and center on the tower.

content.description: Wow. Best way to the top of the tower. Easy to the north platform but from there unprotected climbing up the face, slightly left, and to the top. Unnamed route #3 in Sven's guidebook.
content.protection: Trad. Only a pink and white tri-cam allow you to protect the moves off the north platform. They won't keep you from hitting the platform but they will keep you from falling all the way off. Small wires are needed for a top anchor.
content.location:
Start at the low point of the tower and follow the crack to the overhang. Traverse under the overhang to the north platform. 

  To get down lower your partner to the north platform and using them as an anchor rap off the opposite side. There's a piton with quick link on it to keep the rope from sliding off.

content.description: Follow the left angle diagonal crack.
content.location: On the face left of Tyrolean Tower. Middle of three routes.

content.description: HIDDEN GEM ALERT! I would have given it 4 stars but for a potentially reachy move at the top. Laybacking through a technical crux in the middle to a double-gaston has you staring a meager foot smears and a dynamic lunge to a finishing sloper.
content.protection: TR or Trad. This might be one of the best protected 5.10's in the park provided you have a purple C3 or the equivalent for the top crux.
content.location: Left of Tyrolean Tower is a wall with three climbs. This is the far left crack system. All holds are game including the left arete.

content.description: The Gap is listed in Sven's guidebook as starting in "The Gap" between the south wall of T Tower and a blank face. I started the route on "No Way Down" and belayed my partner to the ledge to do the rest of the route. The 5.8 version goes up a layback crack then right to the corner, a 5.9 version goes straight up (not recommended).
content.protection: SKETCHY! I brought up a crash pad for the first part and got two ok cams in a horizontal for some weird moves up and right. Belay standing on a small ledge on the corner.
content.location: Climb the first half of "No Way Down" and exit right to a ledge. Find the thin crack and solo to the horizontal.

content.description: Very cool tower and a nice face to the south.
